PolicyPage.Name: University Village Requirements (Eligibility)
PolicyPage.Title: Who can live at University Village?
PolicyPage.Abstract: The contract holder at University Village must be a current student admitted to the University. Typically, that means the student is admitted to a track and seeking a degree. For more details, click to learn more.
PolicyPage.BodyCopy:
Students that have been admitted to BYU-Idaho and have received a track assignment are eligible to live in approved housing. It is not required for both husband and wife to be students; only one tenant is required to be a student to hold a contract. Single students over the age of 30 or single parents are welcome to live at University Village (please review the occupancy guidelines for more information).

Student-families may also live in University Village during their off-track. Academic Suspensions and Honor Code Suspensions will apply to their student eligibility as a tenant. Graduated students are not eligible to remain at University Village after their admission status has changed.

If you have any questions, please contact the University Village managers at (208) 496-9285.
